description.compact: Defines additional fields that are only needed for the root package

docblock.description: PackageInterface & derivatives are considered internal, you may use them in type hints but extending/implementing them is not recommended and not supported. Things may change without notice.

description.compact: Returns a set of package names and their aliases

return.description: string, version: string, alias: string, alias_normalized: string}>

description.compact: Returns the minimum stability of the package
Returns the stability flags to apply to dependencies
Returns a set of package names and source references that must be enforced on them
Returns true if the root package prefers picking stable packages over unstable ones
Returns the root package's configuration

Set the recommended packages
Set the conflicting packages

Set the packages this one replaces

Set the autoload mapping
Set the dev autoload mapping
Set the stabilityFlags
Set the minimumStability
Set the preferStable
Set the config
Set the references
Set the aliases

param.description: string version: string, alias: string, alias_normalized: string}> $aliases

description.compact: Set the suggested packages

param.description: string> $suggests A set of package names/comments

description.compact: Returns the scripts of this package

return.description: string[]> Map of script name to array of handlers

description.compact: Returns an array of repositories
Set the repositories
Returns the package license, e.g. MIT, BSD, GPL
Set the license
Returns an array of keywords relating to the package
Set the keywords
Returns the package description
Set the description
Returns the package homepage
Set the homepage
Returns an array of authors of the package

docblock.description: Each item can contain name/homepage/email keys

return.description: string, homepage?: string, email?: string, role?: string}>

param.description: string homepage?: string, email?: string, role?: string}> $authors

description.compact: Returns the support information

description.compact: Returns an array of funding options for the package

docblock.description: Each item will contain type and url keys

description.compact: Set the funding
Returns if the package is abandoned or not
If the package is abandoned and has a suggested replacement, this method returns it
Returns default base filename for archive
Sets default base filename for archive
Returns a list of patterns to exclude from package archives
Sets a list of patterns to be excluded from archives
Returns the package's name without version info, thus not a unique identifier
Returns the package's pretty (i.e. with proper case) name
Returns a set of names that could refer to this package

docblock.description: No version or release type information should be included in any of the names. Provided or replaced package names need to be returned as well.

param.description: Whether provided names should be included

return.description: An array of strings referring to this package

description.compact: Allows the solver to set an id for this package to refer to it.
Retrieves the package's id set through setId
Returns whether the package is a development virtual package or a concrete one
Returns the package type, e.g. library
Returns the package targetDir property
Returns the package extra data
Sets source from which this package was installed (source/dist).
Returns source from which this package was installed (source/dist).
Returns the repository type of this package, e.g. git, svn
Returns the repository url of this package, e.g. git://github.com/naderman/composer.git
Returns the repository urls of this package including mirrors, e.g. git://github.com/naderman/composer.git
Returns the repository reference of this package, e.g. master, 1.0.0 or a commit hash for git
Returns the source mirrors of this package
Returns the type of the distribution archive of this version, e.g. zip, tarball
Returns the url of the distribution archive of this version
Returns the urls of the distribution archive of this version, including mirrors
Returns the reference of the distribution archive of this version, e.g. master, 1.0.0 or a commit hash for git
Returns the sha1 checksum for the distribution archive of this version
Returns the dist mirrors of this package
Returns the version of this package
Returns the pretty (i.e. non-normalized) version string of this package
Returns the pretty version string plus a git or hg commit hash of this package

param.description: If the source reference is a sha1 hash, truncate it
One of the DISPLAY_ constants on this interface determining display of references

description.compact: Returns the release date of the package
Returns the stability of this package: one of (dev, alpha, beta, RC, stable)
Returns a set of links to packages which need to be installed before this package can be installed

return.description: Link> A map of package links defining required packages, indexed by the require package's name

description.compact: Returns a set of links to packages which must not be installed at the same time as this package

return.description: An array of package links defining conflicting packages

description.compact: Returns a set of links to virtual packages that are provided through this package

return.description: An array of package links defining provided packages

description.compact: Returns a set of links to packages which can alternatively be satisfied by installing this package

return.description: An array of package links defining replaced packages

description.compact: Returns a set of links to packages which are required to develop this package. These are installed if in dev mode.

return.description: Link> A map of package links defining packages required for development, indexed by the require package's name

description.compact: Returns a set of package names and reasons why they are useful in combination with this package.

return.description: An array of package suggestions with descriptions

description.compact: Returns an associative array of autoloading rules
Returns an associative array of dev autoloading rules
Returns a list of directories which should get added to PHP's include path.
Stores a reference to the repository that owns the package
Returns a reference to the repository that owns the package
Returns the package binaries
Returns package unique name, constructed from name and version.
Returns the package notification url
Converts the package into a readable and unique string
Converts the package into a pretty readable string
Returns a list of options to download package dist files
Configures the list of options to download package dist files
Set dist and source references and update dist URL for ones that contain a reference
